result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:15 AM Defendant Lavell L Payne in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Lavell L Payne.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  The vehicle has been released.  Defense is going to file a motion to sever.

Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:53 AM . Defendant Lavell L Payne in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Lavell L Payne.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. There is a motion to return property on file.  Defense makes further argument.  Defense has reached out to the State.  The State does not have any information.  Back in June the State was not prepared to release the vehicle.  The State has not communicated with the Sheriff's dept. to confirm all investigation is done.  BTC: Vehicle to be released August 26, 2022 at 5PM. Court admonishes the defendant on his attire.  Defense asks for another status in 30 days.

8:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Lavell L Payne appeared in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have counsel at this time.

BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits due to lack of counsel.
Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Lavell L Payne appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Lavell L Payne. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
